term.title: crazing

item.text: Formation of cavities, when a polymer is stressed, which contain load-bearing fibrils spanning the gap between the surfaces of each cavity.

sources.item: PAC, 1996, 68, 2313. 'Definitions of terms relating to degradation, aging, and related chemical transformations of polymers (IUPAC Recommendations 1996)' on page 2317 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199668122313)

term.citation: Citation: 'crazing' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.CT06850

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
